entry.name: Ashwrought Colossus
entry.description: A towering giant formed from layered volcanic glass, fused ash, and molten sorrow. Each step reshapes the battlefield, leaving trails of slow-burning ground and erupting embers.
entry.hue_interaction: Unstable around Vermilion and Burnt Sienna hues. Contact with Crimson-imbued relics may cause it to fracture and enter an enraged state.
entry.behavior: Patrols volcanic ruins with slow, deliberate movements. Slams the ground to release pyroclastic waves. Periodically collapses, reforming from ash shortly after.
entry.weaknesses: Vulnerable to resonance-based seismic spells and ancient cooling chants. Fractures under its own rage if baited into overexertion.
entry.notes: Legends say it was once a mountain-top guardian, mourning a sunken city. Some claim you can still hear bells when it raises its arms — bells from a temple long buried in ash.

lore.title: Ashwrought Colossus – Emberwake Monument
lore.quote: "It carries a city’s grief in its chest."
flavor_description: Each footstep echoes like a funeral drum across broken obsidian plains.
Flames flicker through its cracks — not of fire, but of memory igniting.
field_notes: We tried to outrun it. That was foolish. It doesn’t chase — it buries.
Wherever it steps, something is erased.
We found carvings inside its chestplate. Not glyphs. Names. Hundreds of them, worn away by soot.
lore.source: Etched excerpts from the Emberwake Expeditions
